column4: it can get pretty indepth on larger networks, but generally what you want to do is download and run it, then, if you're using DHCP point all boxes on the segment to that internal address to use it as DNS.  You'll have to probably set up your host record in there, but you do it once and it's good.
*nods*  Yeah, being able to ssh <boxname> from any machine on your network is always nice though ;)
And if it's taking 15 seconds to nat out and back in, that's like trying to connect to your own house from a router on the moon.
